issue.title: glasgowlive.co.uk

comment.body:
It looks like similar to this case - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/138817
So this rule:
```adblock
glasgowlive.co.uk#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'chameleonVideo.adDisabledRequested', 'true')
```
should fix video player and it shouldn't be necessary to unblock cookie notice and other requests.

You can add the following filter into your uBO user filters to resolve:
```adblock
||bestnetflixmovies.com/adblockscript/
```

[^1]: https://www.similarweb.com/website/bestnetflixmovies.com/#traffic

review.body:
There is also an issue with scrolling on my end.
Screenshot: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33488229/217789996-7a1cf94a-b4fc-4e5d-8c1e-e0a2a4b49925.png)

Caused by ```adblock news-buzz1.com,kyousoku.net,itainews.com,oumaga-times.com,paranormal-ch.com,shuraba-matome.com,2chblog.jp,blog.jp,blog.livedoor.jp,blogo.jp,doorblog.jp,ldblog.jp,livedoor.biz,livedoor.blog#?#.plugin-memo > div.side > div[id^="gad-fixed"]:upward(2) ``` I'd recommend to do next: 1. Remove the domain `ldblog.jp` from the rule above. 2. Add it to this rule ```adblock inutomo11.com,kidan-m.com#$?#.plugin-memo:has(> div.side > div[id^="gad-fixed"]) { remove: true; } ```

comment.body:
Your scriptlet is fine, but what about content blockers?
I'd say these rules are enough. Add the exceptions to `! SECTION: Anti-adblock - The rules for content blockers only`.
```adblock
fosslinux.com#@#.adsbygoogle
fosslinux.com#@#.sidebar-ad
fosslinux.com#@#.Ad-Container
fosslinux.com#$#.adsbygoogle.Ad-Container.sidebar-ad { display: block !important; }
```

issue.title: Add guildeducation.com domain to Optimizely

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

If users have the AdGuard enabled in their adblocking extensions, then they cannot load our feature flags and a/b tests. The effect is different across our product, such as missing new functionality, new styles, or new versions of existing capabilities. This is especially problematic when we expect all users of a customer to have access to a capability they have paid for.

Here are the websites we are having trouble with

`https://*.guildeducation.com`
`https://optimizely.guildeducation.com/*`
`https://*.guildeducation.com/optimizelydatafile=*`
`https://cdn.optimizely.com/datafiles/* with referrer from https://*.guildeducation.com`

### Proposed solution

Adding `guildeducation.com` to the AllowedList of domains for Optimizely .

### Additional information

Our companys product, offered through [guildeducation.com](http://guildeducation.com/) does not serve any types of ads or ad-related materials. We are an education benefit provider, helping connect our users to debt-free education. We do use Optimizely for product management best practices of testing new offerings for our users.

comment.body: Need steps to reproduce, enabled filters, and probably a test account with steps to reproduce(you can send it to filters@adguard.com).

comment.body:
Could you disable DNS, leave only protection from dpi in stealth options and AdGuard Base? Then update the filters in the app, clear cache in the browser, restart it and open the site.
It was fixed by this rule and I can't reproduce it anymore

```adblock
@@||elearning.ual.pt^$stealth
```
@BlazDT @AdamWr please also check this.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Get rid of legacy Extended CSS syntax

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

issue.body:
### Steps:
1. Check if the site is existing
2. If the site is dead - remove all rules for this site
3. If working - check for applied `[-ext-` rules and remove unused rules or convert to the actual syntax, if a rule applied.

This task is only about extcss, so the detailed check is optional (you can create a separate list with missed ads and process it in another task).

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://tumblr.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftumblr.com) ### Comment > AdGuard breaking tumblr mobile share links > > Ive contacted tumblr support about this issue, but wanted to ask AdGuard as well. > > Tumblr recently updated how it does their share links in the mobile app to include tracking analytics. I found a comprehensive explanation here: https://pizza-and-ramen.tumblr.com/post/696959487758745600/tumblr-is-tracking-shared-links > > The problem is that with AdGuard enabled, the URL shortening seems to break. And so, in the tumblr mobile app, clicking Share > Copy URL on that same post gives me this monstrosity: > > https://at.tumblr.com/a/key_live_loIM22jCfY1c0N7G2HnBDcmjDCpTeypJ?%24randomized_bundle_token=1102629599139559913&alias=pizza-and-ramen/tumblr-is-tracking-shared-links/02dv7jdqyrg2&type=0&duration=0&source=ios&%3D%3D > > Now, putting this in a web browser DOES technically work. It loads/redirects a few times and then eventually resolves to the intended post. But, I obviously would prefer not to be sending people links that look like. well. THAT. > > This is in the tumblr app, not a browser, so safari filters do not apply. Only DNS settings. > > Im hoping to find a workaround and would appreciate any help. Ive tried whitelisting the following domains, but it hasnt helped: > > tumblr.com > at.tumblr.com > tumblr.app.link > api-http2.tumblr.com > branch.io > > Any ideas? Thank you! ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/XgLYzUo.jpg)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/FLuMpGB.jpg)

THAT. > > This is in the tumblr app, not a browser, so safari filters do not apply. Only DNS settings. > > Im hoping to find a workaround and would appreciate any help. Ive tried whitelisting the following domains, but it hasnt helped: > > tumblr.com > at.tumblr.com > tumblr.app.link > api-http2.tumblr.com > branch.io > > Any ideas? Thank you! ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/XgLYzUo.jpg)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/FLuMpGB.jpg)
